description.narrative:
Insatsen avser ett programstöd genom poolfinansiering till UNDP Armenien om totalt 18 200 000 SEK för att implementera programmet "Modern Parliament for a Modern Armenia” under perioden 2019-2022.
Insatsen syftar till att stärka kapaciteten hos det nybildade armeniska parlamentet i dess nyckelfunktioner; lagstiftning, granskning och representation. Detta med fokus på ökad kvalitet, transparens, innovation samt att främja inkluderande ansatser och arbetssätt så att de grupper som generellt exkluderats i parlamentarisk verksamhet i ökad utsträckning inkluderas. Insatsen syftar även till att stärka kompetens och kapacitet för att främja och säkerställa jämställdhet och respekt för mänskliga rättigheter i parlamentets och kommittéernas policy-utveckling, i lagstiftning och i den i övriga parlamentariska verksamheten.
Den totala budgeten för projektet uppgår till 5 000 000 USD (cirka 48 465 500 SEK) för perioden 2019-2022, av vilken Sida kommer att bidra med 18 200 000 SEK i stöd genom en samlingsfond (basket fund). Den återstående delen planeras att täckas med medel från andra institutionella givare så som Storbritannien och Tyskland. Sveriges utrikesdepartement har redan bidragit med 205 200 USD till den katalytiska fasen av projektet som utgör projektets sex första månader. Den armeniska regeringen har parallellt budgeterat för renoveringar av nationalförsamlingens lokaler vilket också kommer att bidra till projektet.

The proposed intervention is a request from UNDP to contribute to the project “Modern Parliament for a Modern Armenia” during the period 2019-2022 with a total amount of 18 200 000 SEK.
The purpose of the project is to strengthen the newly established National Assembly in its fundamentally enhanced role within the governance system. The project aims to enhance capacities of the Armenian legislature in carrying out its key functions of law-making, oversight and representation, focusing on improved quality, transparency, inclusiveness of parliamentary operations as well as enhanced parliamentary capacity for gender-responsive policy making. The project additionally aims at cultivating innovation, design and technology as drivers of parliamentary strengthening.
The project will be implemented through a basket fund model. The total amount of the project is estimated to USD 5 000 000 (approximately 48 138 000 SEK) for the period 2019-2022. Sida intend to commit to the basket fund with SEK 18 200 000 which is what has been requested by UNDP. The Swedish MFA has already committed with USD 209 754 for the catalytic stage of the project. The UK have committed with USD 2 021 634. The Armenian government have in parallel budgeted for constructions in 2020 of the NA premises which will gain the project.

The purpose of the project is to strengthen the newly established National Assembly in its fundamentally enhanced role within the governance system. The project aims to enhance capacities of the Armenian legislature in carrying out its key functions of law-making, oversight and representation, focusing on improved quality, transparency, inclusiveness of parliamentary operations as well as enhanced parliamentary capacity for gender-responsive policy making. The project additionally aims at cultivating innovation, design and technology as drivers of parliamentary strengthening. The project is expected to result in the following overarching outcomes: 1) Quality of legislative oversight and policy making is improved 2) Transparency and accountability of legislative processes is increased 3) Legislative responsiveness, inclusivity and participatory approach is embedded in MP's work

title.narrative: Third party cost-sharing agreement between Sweden and UNDP
Beslut om insats UNDP Armenien Parlamentsstöd 2019-2022

description.narrative: The project has been able to achieve results in all the three Outcomes despite the challenges of the Covid-19 situation and the war in Nagorno-Karabach. The Parliament of Armenia remained open as one of the few parliaments in the world during the pandemic. Some results that have been achieved by the project is its work with almost all National Assembly Standing Committees and a number of subcommittees on the Environment. The project has contributed to the participatory policy making and legislative drafting through several innovative mechanisms and platforms. In terms of impact the project has contributed to strengthening the separation of powers and parliamentary democracy by introducing extensive reformatory processes and tools for enhancing the work of the NA and thus strengthening its independence and adding to the process of transitioning from a semi-presidential system into a full parliamentary system. Furthermore, the project provided a contribution towards enhancement of the overall policy making in the NA through provision of a quality research and collection of wide inputs. This in turn provided a demand by MPs for more analytical approach and quality preparation in legislative The Project's impact comes to improve the culture of openness of the RA NA and raising awareness amongst the citizens that they have the right to be informed and consulted. The Project has also been instrumental to contribute to promote dialogue between the civil society and Members of Parliament but also the other two branches of power and experts, the public at large. The Project's support led to legislative impact analyses especially through the CSOs-NA Platform and Townhall Meetings. The public consultations aspect of the platform contributed to the post legislative scrutiny. In terms of gender mainstreaming a Gender Impact Analysis was conduced by the OxYGen Foundation which was submitted to the MAP Project and is waiting final endorsement. 4 sessions on gender responsive budgeting were held, attended by 51 CSO representatives. All sessions were delivered remotely on Zoom and facilitated by a Westminster Foundation expert. The expert also conducted a gender-sensitive rapid review of the Armenia state budget, that contained necessary tools for parliamentarians and the CSO representatives to better monitor the state budget from a gender perspective. It was translated into Armenian and is available for parliamentary stakeholders as well as for the CSO representatives. An expert group developed a Gender Equality Plan for the National Assembly for the next 5 years. The document has been submitted to MAP. The action plan is aimed at providing the MPs with an effective tool, framework and structure for achieving parliamentary gender equality through systematic and well-coordinated efforts. It includes activities at comprehending and achieving gender equality objectives within the National Assembly. In addition a specialized Gender Equality Course online course is developed and tested by the OxYGen team. The training tool is to help MPs and their advisory support staff better understand the country's gender profile as well as gender aspects of the legislative work, social system and structure of the National Assembly, ways and means to remove various hurdles and biases and to move towards gender equality bot within the Parliament and the society at large. The provision of legislative impact analysis in terms of amendments to the following laws: - Labour Law - Paternity leave for the first time in the Republic of Armenia and protection of women's rights with children under 1 year old came into effect on 1 January 2021. These amendments were initiatied by a group of MPs who were actively participating in the CSOs-NA Platform discussions. - Law on Local Self-Government (articles on social and health issues) - Law on Compensation of Damage caused to the Life or Health of Soldier during the Defense of the Republic of Armenia - Law on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities - Law on Lake Sevan - Criminal Code - Civil Code
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
